column4: Alexion says no need to revise earnings  shares rise
column5: Alexion Pharmaceuticals Inc  on Wednesday filed its delayed third-quarter 2016 financial report with U.S. regulators and said an investigation into allegations regarding sales practices found no need to restate previous financial results.

column4: Factbox: Apps removed from Apple's China app store
column5: Apple Inc  removed the New York Times Co's  news apps from its app store in China on Dec. 23  following a request from the Chinese authorities. An Apple spokesman said the company had been informed that the app was "in violation of local regulations".

column4: Apple pulls New York Times apps in China after government request
column5: BEIJING Apple Inc  has removed the New York Times Co's  English- and Chinese-language news apps from its iTunes store in China following a request from the local authorities  the companies said separately on Thursday. | Video

column4: Apple's App Store generated $20 billion for developers in 2016
column5: Apple Inc  said on Thursday its App Store generated $20 billion for developers in 2016  a 40 percent increase from 2015  helped by the popularity of games such as Pokemon Go and Super Mario Run and increased revenue from subscriptions.

column4: India reluctant to give special tax incentives to Apple
column5: India is resisting tech giant Apple Inc's  demand for tax incentives to make iPhones in the country  with the trade minister saying on Thursday that the government may not make exceptions for the U.S. company.

column4: Private hiring slows in December  jobs market still solid
column5: U.S. private employers added 153 000 jobs in December  fewer than in November  but the labor market remained solid  a report by a payrolls processor showed on Thursday.

column4: Fox News anchor Greta Van Susteren joins MSNBC
column5: Comcast Corp's  MSNBC unit said on Thursday that Fox News veteran Greta Van Susteren had joined the company and will host a new program called "For the Record".

column4: Halozyme's pancreatic cancer drug succeeds in mid-stage trial
column5: Halozyme Therapeutics Inc said its lead experimental drug  in tandem with therapies from Celgene Corp and Eli Lilly and Co  succeeded in a mid-stage study involving patients with an advanced form of pancreatic cancer.

column4: Otonomy's ear infection drug succeeds in late-stage trial
column5: Drug developer Otonomy Inc said on Thursday its drug to treat acute otitis externa (AOE)  an infection in the outer ear canal  met the main goal in a late-stage trial.

column4: Sears' Craftsman deal deflects focus from dismal holiday sales
column5: Sears Holdings Corp  said it would sell its Craftsman tools business to Stanley Black & Decker Inc  for $900 million  sending its shares up and taking some of the focus away from the company's dismal holiday season performance.

column4: Viacom names global entertainment group COO
column5: Viacom Inc  on Thursday named Sarah Levy  the chief operating officer of its Nickelodeon network  COO of its global entertainment group  as new Chief Executive Bob Bakish seeks to turn around the ailing media company.

column4: Viacom names global entertainment group COO
column5: Viacom Inc  on Thursday named Sarah Levy  the chief operating officer of its Nickelodeon network  COO of its global entertainment group  as new Chief Executive Bob Bakish seeks to turn around the ailing media company.

column4: Walgreens profit beats estimates on PBM partnerships
column5: Walgreens Boots Alliance Inc  reported a better-than-expected quarterly profit as recent partnerships with pharmacy benefit managers (PBMs) and insurance companies helped boost sales of prescription drugs as well as non-drug items.

column4: Allergan expects mid-single digit 2017 revenue growth
column5: Allergan Plc   taking a more "realistic" approach to its forecast  said on Thursday it expects mid-single digit net revenue percentage growth this year  helped by key products and new launches.

column4: U.S. loses bid to overturn AmEx antitrust decision
column5: NEW YORK A federal appeals court on Thursday rejected the U.S. government's request that it reconsider its decision allowing American Express Co  to stop merchants from encouraging customers to use rival cards that charge lower fees.

column4: Former Ares Management partners to form new private equity fund
column5: Two former Ares Management LP  private equity executives have joined forces to form a new firm called LightBay Capital focused on middle-market buyouts and distressed debt investments  according to people familiar with the matter.

column4: Trump remains opposed to AT&T-Time Warner deal: Bloomberg
column5: Donald Trump remains opposed to AT&T Inc's  planned $85.4 billion acquisition of Time Warner Inc   Bloomberg reported  citing people close to the president-elect.

column4: Exclusive: BRF sees $1.5 billion Halal unit IPO by late March - sources
column5: SAO PAULO Brazilian food exporter BRF SA is seeking to raise about $1.5 billion from the sale of a 20 percent stake of a unit focused on the halal processed food market via an initial public offering  two people with direct knowledge of the plan said on Thursday.

column4: Exclusive: BRF seeks IPO of halal food unit by early April  sources say
column5: SAO PAULO BRF SA  the world's largest poultry exporter  wants to raise about $1.5 billion from the sale of a 20 percent stake in a subsidiary focused on the halal processed food market via an initial public offering  two people with direct knowledge of the plan said on Thursday.

column4: Exclusive: BRF sees $1.5 billion Halal unit IPO by late March - sources
column5: SAO PAULO Brazilian food exporter BRF SA is seeking to raise about $1.5 billion from the sale of a 20 percent stake of a unit focused on the halal processed food market via an initial public offering  two people with direct knowledge of the plan said on Thursday.

column4: BAT quits nicotine inhaler to focus on vaping
column5: LONDON British American Tobacco (BAT)  has quit plans to market a nicotine inhaler called Voke to focus on consumer items like e-cigarettes rather than health products.

column4: Fox News anchor Greta Van Susteren joins MSNBC
column5: Comcast Corp's  MSNBC unit said on Thursday that Fox News veteran Greta Van Susteren had joined the company and will host a new program called "For the Record".

column4: Constellation profit beat clouded by Trump tax proposals
column5: Constellation Brands Inc   which makes most of its beer in Mexico  reported a higher-than-expected quarterly profit  but investors remained jittery about President-elect Donald Trump's proposals to tighten cross-border trade.

column4: Deutsche Bank names Philippe Vollot as new anti-financial crime chief
column5: FRANKFURT Deutsche Bank has named Philippe Vollot as its new head of fighting financial crime  it said  replacing Peter Hazlewood who is leaving the post after just six months.

column4: Deutsche Bank to pay $95 million to end U.S. tax fraud case
column5: NEW YORK Deutsche Bank AG  agreed to pay $95 million to resolve a U.S. government lawsuit accusing the German bank of tax fraud for using "insolvent" shell companies to hide significant tax liabilities from the Internal Revenue Service in 2000.

column4: Ford expands Alexa use  heating up auto personal assistant battle
column5: LAS VEGAS Ford Motor Co  is expanding the use of Amazon.com Inc's  Alexa personal assistant in its vehicles to allow drivers to talk to their cars - demanding anything from a nearby cheeseburger to a weather forecast - marking a leap by the Detroit automaker to incorporate a technology initially targeted for home use.

column4: Gap bucks trend with surprise December comparable sales rise
column5: Gap Inc  reported a surprise rise in December comparable sales  and said it expected 2016 profit to be above the higher end of forecast  in sharp contrast to weak holiday sales from department store operators and some apparel retailers.

column4: IT research firm Gartner to buy CEB to expand business analysis
column5: IT research and advisory company Gartner Inc  said on Thursday it would buy CEB Inc   a provider of business research and analysis  in a cash-and-stock deal valued at $2.6 billion to expand its business services.

column4: GM's Cadillac to start car subscription concierge service in NYC
column5: DETROIT General Motors Co  on Feb. 1 will begin a $1 500-per-month on-demand concierge subscription service for Cadillac cars and SUVs in New York  a program it hopes will expand to major cities in the United States  Cadillac said on Thursday.

column4: GM's China vehicle sales rise 7.1 percent year-on-year in 2016
column5: BEIJING General Motors Co  and its joint venture partners sold 3.87 million vehicles in China in 2016  up 7.1 percent from the previous year  cementing the country's position as the U.S. automaker's top market for a fifth consecutive year.

column4: Toyota  Honda say no immediate plans to curb Mexico production
column5: TOKYO The presidents of Toyota Motor Corp  and Honda Motor Co Ltd  said they have no immediate plans to curb production in Mexico  preferring to wait until after Donald Trump's inauguration as U.S. President this month before deciding whether to make any changes.

column4: Macy's  Kohl's slash 2016 profit forecasts citing weak holiday sales
column5: Department store chains Macy's Inc  and Kohl's Corp  both cut their 2016 profit forecasts on Wednesday  after holiday season sales fell more than expected  pushing down shares in the retail sector in extended trading.

column4: LG Display in talks to supply LCD TV panels to Samsung Elec
column5: SEOUL South Korea's LG Display Co Ltd said it was in talks with Samsung Electronics Co Ltd about a supply agreement for television display panels.

column4: Dismal holiday sales at Macy's and Kohl's cast gloom over sector
column5: Disappointing holiday-season sales at Macy's Inc  and Kohl's Corp  underscored the uphill task facing department stores to win back shoppers  who are increasingly turning to online retailers and spending less on apparel. | Video

column4: Macy's  Kohl's slash 2016 profit forecasts citing weak holiday sales
column5: Department store chains Macy's Inc  and Kohl's Corp  both cut their 2016 profit forecasts on Wednesday  after holiday season sales fell more than expected  pushing down shares in the retail sector in extended trading.

column4: Sears' Craftsman deal deflects focus from dismal holiday sales
column5: Sears Holdings Corp  said it would sell its Craftsman tools business to Stanley Black & Decker Inc  for $900 million  sending its shares up and taking some of the focus away from the company's dismal holiday season performance.

column4: Meredith approaches Time Inc over potential merger: Bloomberg
column5: Media company Meredith Corp  has contacted Time Inc  to express intent in a potential merger  Bloomberg reported  citing people familiar with the matter.

column4: Monsanto swings to profit on higher South America demand
column5: Chicago U.S. seeds and agrochemicals company Monsanto Co   which is in the process of being bought by Germany's Bayer AG  for $66 billion  swung to a quarterly profit  helped by higher demand from South America.

column4: Apple pulls New York Times apps in China after government request
column5: BEIJING Apple Inc  has removed the New York Times Co's  English- and Chinese-language news apps from its iTunes store in China following a request from the local authorities  the companies said separately on Thursday. | Video

column4: Shake Shack names first COO; says CFO to retire
column5: Shake Shack Inc   known for its indulgent hamburgers  crinkle-cut fries and frozen custard shakes  named company veteran Zach Koff as its first chief operating officer  and said Chief Financial Officer Jeff Uttz will retire.

column4: Sears' Craftsman deal deflects focus from dismal holiday sales
column5: Sears Holdings Corp  said it would sell its Craftsman tools business to Stanley Black & Decker Inc  for $900 million  sending its shares up and taking some of the focus away from the company's dismal holiday season performance.

column4: Sears' Craftsman deal deflects focus from dismal holiday sales
column5: Sears Holdings Corp  said it would sell its Craftsman tools business to Stanley Black & Decker Inc  for $900 million  sending its shares up and taking some of the focus away from the company's dismal holiday season performance.

column4: Sears' Craftsman deal deflects focus from dismal holiday sales
column5: Sears Holdings Corp  said it would sell its Craftsman tools business to Stanley Black & Decker Inc  for $900 million  sending its shares up and taking some of the focus away from the company's dismal holiday season performance.

column4: Blackstone's new investment tune hits right notes
column5: NEW YORK (Reuters Breakingviews) - Blackstone is going long music. For its first venture into buying and holding companies for extended periods of time  the private-equity firm is taking over SESAC  a group that manages song rights for the likes of Bob Dylan and Mariah Carey. The growth of streaming provides a steady outlook. With some financial improvisation  it's easy to compose a healthy return.

column4: Meredith approaches Time Inc over potential merger: Bloomberg
column5: Media company Meredith Corp  has contacted Time Inc  to express intent in a potential merger  Bloomberg reported  citing people familiar with the matter.

column4: Trump remains opposed to AT&T-Time Warner deal: Bloomberg
column5: Donald Trump remains opposed to AT&T Inc's  planned $85.4 billion acquisition of Time Warner Inc   Bloomberg reported  citing people close to the president-elect.

column4: Mexico's peso reverses losses after weakening on Trump Toyota threat
column5: MEXICO CITY Mexico's battered peso currency reversed losses on Thursday after weakening more than 0.6 percent following a tweet from U.S. President-elect Donald Trump threatening Toyota Motor Corp with a "big border tax" if it builds a new factory in Mexico to build cars for the U.S. market.

column4: Toyota  Honda say no immediate plans to curb Mexico production
column5: TOKYO The presidents of Toyota Motor Corp  and Honda Motor Co Ltd  said they have no immediate plans to curb production in Mexico  preferring to wait until after Donald Trump's inauguration as U.S. President this month before deciding whether to make any changes.

column4: U.S. December auto sales surprisingly strong  2016 sets new high
column5: DETROIT U.S. sales of new cars and trucks hit a record high in 2016  automakers said on Wednesday  and investors bid up shares in the sector as strong consumer confidence and relatively low fuel prices bolstered the industry's outlook. | Video

column4: Synthetic Biologics' C. difficile mid-stage study meets main goal
column5: Synthetic Biologics Inc said its experimental treatment designed to reduce antibiotic-resistant "superbug" infections - notably life-threatening C. difficile - outperformed a placebo in a trial.
